pages.text: Eventually it becomes necessary to create a connection between two places that are far far apart. A network link can be used when normal tear ducts will not suffice.
This is not a cheap option, and you will need at least two.

Before it can wirelessly transfer anything that can travel through normal ducts, it must be activated and linked to a network. Similarly to a beacon the link is a beam extending into the sky, and that beam can be colored with glass.

Unlike a beacon this beam has a lot of meaning, as a network link can only connect to links of the same color, and cannot be activated without a change in color. Use a divining rod to do the actual activation, and make sure both ends have the same beam color.

Once activated, anything travelling through a duct network that cannot find a destination locally will try through every other link of the same color, oldest first. It can only travel through one color however, and will always choose the nearest link to it's source.
